Containers.Name: malfurious-mailserver
Containers.Description: This docker is designed to be used with malfurious-postfixadmin, malfurious-redis, and malfurious-roundcube. This docker requires a mysql database to connect to, preferably MariaDB. Create a database named "postfix" with a user named "postfix". Set your own password for the user. Enter your MariaDB/MySQL IP address or hostname for DBHOST. For DBPASS fill in the password you used when you setup your mysql database for user postfix. Also under Extra Parameters, replace "mail.domain.td" in "-h mail.domain.td" with the hostname for your mailserver. To use SSL, such as with LetsEncrypt, add a path variable pointing to /etc/letsencrypt on this docker. Your certificates should use the following format from within that directory: Inside /etc/letsencrypt: /live/mail.domain.td/fullchain.pem = certificate, /live/mail.domain.td/privkey.pem = certificate key. Port 11334 is for the RSPAMD webgui. Finally, all credit for this docker goes to Hardware, I am merely formatting it for use in UnRaid as a template. Any other configuration settings you may be interested will be listed at: https://github.com/hardware/mailserver
Containers.Overview: Mailserver is an all-in-one SMTP/IMAP utility that also includes many features such as Anti-Spam/Virus filters.
